rComments: Prof. King has the best lectures that prompt you to attend class. His sense of humor has the whole room laughing, yet he can be confusing at times. Make an effort to really pay attention and put your mind to it; philosophy isn't easy and sometimes King doesn't explain extremely well but I would take a class I hated just to have him again.

I took this classes based on many good reviews from students here and other discussion boards. It ended up being the worst class Ive ever taken in my years at uoft. Also, the TAs were inconsistent in their marking where one was a lot harder than the other. Many students ended up complaining

He is a really nice, accommodating and engaging lecturer. Im not sure what other classes he teaches but would do this class again if I could (PHL285). Im a life sci student and took this as an elective.

Professor King is a kind hearted and brilliant guy. His lectures are organized like a paper, and are easy to follow and entertaining. We are very lucky to have him at UofT. I'm not an art student in any way, and learned a lot from him. Very enjoyable.

Prof King made lectures so fun! He is a very funny man who really knows what he's talking about. He puts lecture notes online as well as in class to follow along to but it is much easier to just listen to him and review the notes later. There were about 6 essays to write during the school year so his lecture notes became my best friend.
King's lecture is so clear, just like his lecture note. I really learn some philosophy concepts and develop arguments from his course.
King was the best. Made the lectures incredibly interesting and his notes were concise and explained the material very well. I would recommend anyone take his classes, I know I would again.

His lectures are often entertaining but do not actually clarify Augustine's views. Essay topics were dry but he has high standards of original thinking and argumentation. Unless you're passionate about medieval philosophy, save your gpa and avoid classes where King is grading you himself (300+ levels).

His sentences are often cut by attempts to make funny remarks, making it near impossible to follow the content of the lecture most times. 5-6 clear lectures out of the 20 attended this semester. Is easily offended, to the point of students' most unremarkable questions leading to an exaggerated response with a raised voice and panicky gestures.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'So many papers', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Best lectures I've ever taken. I'm not sure if he's performing, or if he's always like that (the latter doesn't necessarily exclude the former). His notes were so crystal clear that I learned Kant without attending class.   A very fair final exam, and my TA was always helpful, ready to respond to emails, and elaborate on tough concepts.

He is hilarious!!!!!! Perfect guy to teach philosophy to freshman, some who have no philosophy background at all. His enthusiasm and passion for what he does literally makes him bounce on stage. Heck, I bounced in my seat too!! WOOHOO KING!

Very funny prof, but do the readings cause he gives a lot of essays, so you should be prepared. but his lectures are helpful too, as long as you write notes. Probably one of the funniest profs, not monotone, doesn't read off a script, and tells interesting stories relating to the course

Top-class professor. Extremely funny. His lectures contain more jokes than philosophical content. Readings are dense, but you dont have to do them to do well. Lecture slides can be distracting as they are just walls of text. It's probably best to just listen to him during class, an then go over the slides (which he posts online) later.

This guy was so into what he was teaching that he was literally hopping all over the stage. Overall incredible prof, very funny, leads through concepts slowly. Overhead material can be distracting b/c it's a lot of text, listen to him instead of reading it. Reading the books is unnecessary to do well, just go to lectures and you'll be fine.
King is an awesome prof.  He explains material really clearly, and well, and makes whatever topic being discussed interesting.  He's always joking around, and makes class fun to attend.

AMAZING professor. Although I don't like philosophy much, King made attending the lectures worth while. The guy is hilarious, and extremely intelligent. He does not test on things not discussed in class, but being in class is a MUST because the readings are extremely difficult and needed to be explained. His explanations are clear. Just amazing.

Best prof in the world. So funny, smart, juste everything a great teacher should be. The guy knows his stuff and his class is seriously like an informative stand up comedy... Amazing guy and well respected by all.

He is THE BEST professor I have ever had. He is funny, witty, insightful, and genius. He is truly a great teacher and the material was very interesting. His notes are very helpful too. I look forward to taking another class with him if possible. He made my first-year that enjoyable. TAKE IT!
Easy to follow and incredibly engaging. Reminded me why I love philosophy. Would love to have him as a professor again!
Interesting professor. Pretty strong and clear lecturer, bit at times told too many jokes.

take his first year philosophy class. this prof is great. he is up there on stage talking and danceing around. he makes evrything intersting, and tells alot of jokes as well. he might be one of the best profs you can have.

Even if you don't like philosophy, King's lecturers make it worthwile taking the course. He's incredibly funny, which is very comforting for first years, and he makes the hard concepts very understandable. Definitely recommend taking this class! He is one of the best professors I have ever had. Brilliant man!

He is an epic philosophy professor! I had him in first year & even though I no longer have him in second year, I still go see him for help with my other philosophy classes and he is more than willing to be of assistance. Just don't lose track during lecture because he can go off on tangents & talk really fast. AMAZING!
Really funny prof! Tends to get sidetracked, but still worth it to attend lectures. Do the readings just because you will take more from the lecture.
Excellent and exiting, his monologues are insightful and he make intelligent jokes that assist in subject recall.

Despite the history-hopping nature of the philosophers we read, King made the whole course coherent and relevant. Perhaps more time could have been spent on each philosopher, but a fantastic introduction course made all the better by his wit and openness.

At first, I wasn't sure if I enjoyed his 'happy go-lucky' personality but I quickly changed my mind. He actually turned medieval philosophy into something interesting.  I would highly recommend taking his class.

He makes philosophy funny and practical. With his wit, he explains concepts in very clear manner. His notes are extremely organized and helpful. The only complaint I have is that he sometimes breaks down concepts too much and misses the subtlety in them.
So funny! Gives great examples and makes sure his class is always awake. He's a great lecturer and he gives very fair exams. He also posts his notes which are EXTREMELY helpful.

King is the best philosophy professor in the philosophy department!! Cracks soo many jokes and speaks soo clearly that even if you didnt have experience with philosophy before you will get it!! hope to see him in future classes as well

King is a perfect representation of just how vibrant philosophy as a subject can be when approached and presented the right way. His classes consist of clear explanations of arguments from the readings as well as many analogies, which is most cases are quite hilarious. Will be looking into more King classes in the future!
Best prof ever
AMAZING PROF!!!!

King is a fantastic lecturer. I learned so much in his class. He's really friendly and always happy to answer the students' questions. Will definitely take his 200 classes. A great person and a great teacher overall.
had him twice. will have him again next semester. good professor. likes to tell crude jokes, and i'm all for that.

Great teacher. He was extremely clear, helpful and funny. I learned so much from his lectures. Has a different style of teaching than Kingwell (also great), which makes it silly to compare them. I will definitely be taking more of his classes!

Amazing, amazing Prof.  I would have to say that my classes with King were the highlight of my time spent at U. of T.  He is a wonderful person - brilliant, funny and kind.  He is a born teacher and the philosophy department is very lucky to have him. (Go Abelard!)
very organized and interesting lectures. incredibly understanding and reasonable yet fair. generally great attitude.

This man made a three-hour 9 A. M. class on John Duns Scotus, easily one of the most boring and abstract medieval philosophers (redundant, isn't it?), the course I ended up enjoying the most. Organized, enthusiastic, funny, easy-going about requirements and such; very reasonable assignments.   Prof. King in one word: SPIFFY
No Comments

My God the man speaks like a well written book- completely clear and so intelligent- really awe inspiring to see how he can make a men like Anselm, and Aquinas really interesting! And for the one comment who was overly sensitive about the french comment- your in university -grow up and learn to take a joke
King is hilarious. He could make an lecture on tax law entertaining. He's totally brilliant, as well. One of the best at U of T, by far.

Pretty systematic when explaining, but he's kind of a loser.  He tries to be funny to seem "cool", you can tell.  And he can be sarcastic and ignorant. he'll say stupid stuff to gain acceptance. ie. and we have the french ppl who eat snails, and whatever!?!!?c'mon grow up.
If there is any reason to attend the University of Toronto, it is to take one of Professor King's classes. He is an inspiration.

(Early Medieval Philosophy) Peter King is the best professor that I have had in not only the PHL department, but all departments. He's very helpful, funny, popular, and clever. He goes through the theories and arguments so carefully that you actually GET them. He makes them so enjoyable, and you really get sucked into it. He loves what he does!

He's the funniest Professor i've ever had...i ended up loathing the material because it would just drive me nuts and i did horribly in the course but i stuck to it and attended every single lecture just to listen to him!
God, do I love this man.  If only all of my profs could be this brilliant, kind, engaging and dedicated. He made me fall in love with the Middle Ages all over again.
"surly, sarcastic and boring"?  This is the antithesis of Professor King! He is a truely kind and fair person who loves teaching and treats everyone with respect in class.
generally surly, sarcastic and boring.
Long live the King!
Great lectures. He really makes an effort to explain complex works clearly to students, and without sacrificing content. His efforts are much appreciated!  I am learning a lot!
My favourite prof at U. of T.  Totally briliant guy. He really cares about teaching.
No Comments
He is great all around.  Very clear lecturer. Great methods of assessment (3 papers).  He is nice (maybe too nice? can someone please tell that guy in the front row to shut the hell up?)
Total genius and a heck of a nice guy. You are nuts if you don't take one of his classes.

King was a solid professor who focused on the details of the philosophical texts at hand. Rather than spending his time giving an in-depth exegesis of the work, he elucidated the fine points of the interesting arguments.

King is engaging, thoughtful and full of life. He jumps at the chance to help students individually, and he makes difficult subject matter accessible. Hands down, he's in my top five profs of all time.
Anyone who can inspire a contemporary continentalist to love medieval philosophy is a genius or a stand-up comic.  Peter King is both. He is an amazing lecturer and a genuinely nice, thoughtful prof.

BEST professor in the department, hands down. Lectures were extremely interesting. Very approachable. Did a superb job of answering questions. 2 short papers and 2 open-book tests = very fair. He's looking for understanding, not regurgitation of facts.
